website_summaries.verdict: A popular brand and a top seller for good reason. When it comes to versatility and quality, you simply can't beat this product.
pros: stands on its own due to foot design
cons: If foot gets stuck on rough terrain, cane could unexpectedly fold

website_summaries.verdict: This cane's pivot head helps keep the rubber feet tips from slipping when you push to walk forward, even on tile and wood floors.
pros: Innovative SteadiGrip stabilizing technology increases traction and improves balance indoors and outdoors
Pivoting tripod base gives you a point of contact with the cane at all times
cons: Does not stand up as well as a true quad cane, so you might have to bend over to retrieve it

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous. Broke in 10 Days.
customer_reviews.text: It never stood upright, it did not have the flexible foot, the bar code is 1/2 scratched off. Even with that it was okay until it broke within 10 days. The adjust button popped off, thankfully it happened while I was folding it to put in the car. If I was using it...imagine this going out from under you. Obviously if you need to use a cane, it should be durable & not cause accidents. I don’t think this is original from the HuuryCane manufacturer, I have since learned theirs come with a certificate. This should be removed from Amazon’s site.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Baby Cane
customer_reviews.text: I had a total knee replacement and wanted a cane that was better looking and easy to use. This is a baby cane with little stability that cannot handle city streets. The advertising is really misleading and it falls at the drop of a hat.
customer_reviews.author: marthab

customer_reviews.title: Broken already!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 85 year old father in March. He has 3 Hurrycanes.... all purchased this past year, and which he uses interchangably. The height adjustment button is already broken on it....truly a safety hazard! As a Registered Nurse and adult caregiver of an elderly parent, I recognize the importance of this issue. I called customer service @ Hurrycane and they were of no assistance whatsoever. Not even willing to bump it “up the chain”. I am so sorry that we purchased 3 of their products before finding this out. I believe they might pay attention to a fall caused by this issue and their unwillingness to stand by their product. ☹️
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M. Siegfreid

customer_reviews.title: PLANNED OBSOLESCENCE/CAN'T FIX IF ELASTIC CORD BREAKS
customer_reviews.text: This cane cannot be repaired by the owner if the elastic cord breaks. This is called "planned obsolescence", a marketing technique, that causes a person to have to buy a new one or send it back to the factory. If you are dependent on it while traveling, you're screwed. --- It also feels "flimsy" and wobbly in use, the hand grip is not large enough around for a large hand, and in my unit the base does not pivot. --- This "fold up" cane does not inspire confidence while in use.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry T.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk and waste of money. If I could give a below zero star rating I would. It arrived on time but the top part is not connected to the rest of the cane (it was frayed and no way to latch the push button to adjust the height). There were no directions included. Therefore it will not stay at the correct height. Did I get one that someone else had sent back? I can't return because I don't have any packaging. Don't waste your money on this !!! Very disappointed as this was a gift for my disabled brother.
customer_reviews.author: PKB

customer_reviews.title: made it sound so great, but I disagree
customer_reviews.text: It's very wobbly and clanks with every step because of the connecting pieces. The handle is too hard, unlike the softer grip I also bought from Amazon. The bottom "tip" is far inferior to my circular one which is a 3 1/4" circle and which I also bought from Amazon. The HurryCane will hang in my closet unused. T.V. made it sound so great, but I disagree.
customer_reviews.author: zanniegrannie

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect ambulatory assistive device !!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 90 year old mother. She absolutely loves it. She has a closet full of single point hook canes from various sources. She never liked using them...........most likely due to poor performance and less than adequate balance assist. Even with use, a single point hook cane does not offer great balance. With the HurryCane Freedom Edition Folding Cane with T Handle she now happily carries and uses everywhere she goes, and loves every feature about it. This should keep her on her feet, with decreased risk of fall for some time to come. A huge level above all of her other canes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tao templar

customer_reviews.title: Questionable quality creates hazardous condition.
customer_reviews.text: Three screws in the rubber tips in the tripod base continually come loose. Lost one of the rubber tips already 12 days old. Threaded nut in the center of the cane also comes loose often. Collectively they have created hazardous condition leading to stumbling while walking. Is mine a lemon or is this a design flaw?
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves it!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my mom for her birthday. She has a straight cane that falls over when she sets it down. She also has a silver 'quad cane' with a large base that she trips on when she tries to use it. The Hurry Cane is the best of both worlds. She loves that it stands up on its own and has a tiny base. She feels much more secure with it. She tells me the hand grip is very comfortable and she also likes the wrist strap. Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie M.

customer_reviews.title: Product quality is not what it used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these canes for years. They no longer last what they used to. There is a rubber ring that connects the triangular base to the rest of the cane that is now lasting less than 10 days before it starts breaking. The cane eventually stops standing up on its own. It is a pity because I love these canes, but I have to buy them in bulk because they don't last and they do not sell replacements for this. I called hurrycane and was told that they have NEVER heard of this issue. This is the fifth cane with this issue I have had. I find it hard to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Guhu

customer_reviews.title: New version of cane inferior to the old
customer_reviews.text: I have been using HurryCanes for six years and this version is so inferior to those of the past that I am looking for another brand for future orders. The rubber footing falls off the cane stand every few days...no washer to counter the torque as with older versions. I now carry a Philips head screwdriver in my daypack to check the cane's feet ever day or so. Really disappointing in what once was a fine and reliant a product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Moore

customer_reviews.title: Great balancing power and so easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I cannot explain how much this cane has helped me. I’m young and using a cane is not the fashionable way to get around but I have tried other canes that look like they’re good, steady canes but they actually slow me down or trip me up. The HurryCane has given me so much better balancing power on my walking without slowing me down. Yes, I am still a young woman with a cane but at least I’m going places on my own and with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: HGrace

customer_reviews.title: Used a couple of times then handle broke
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a gift for my 85 year old mom. She actually love it but only used it a couple of times when the screw that held the handle on broke. Now the handle keeps falling off. I can't return it and don't know how to fix it. I think it should have lasted longer for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Z.

customer_reviews.title: we were delighted with this cane
customer_reviews.text: Initially, we were delighted with this cane. But it is now rendered useless because the spring-loaded button that secures the height of the pin has disappeared into the hollow portion of the cane. Obviously, this mechanism was not securely fastened during its construction. I am relieved that the pin did not give way while being used--that would have caused my mother certain injury!
customer_reviews.author: BStaal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I ordered twelve (12) of these canes for our clinic and am quite dissatisfied. The connecting cord of one cane broke as the patient unfolded it. The packaging makes distinguishing the plastic bands from the wrist strap difficult leading another patient to cut the wrist strap. In the past I ordered these same canes and they were fine. I notice they are now made in Chine and not USA. The quality has gone down and I plan to return the rest.
customer_reviews.author: Carole Muto

customer_reviews.title: NOT ELDERLY FRIENDLY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my 84 yr old mom in another state and had to wait till I went home to get it back because she has no way to return it. The pin on cane fell off when she trying to put together so she never got to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not like the original
customer_reviews.text: Certainly buyers remorse. I purchased one for my older Aunt when the HurryCane first came out and she loved it. It had a very sturdy robust foot / base. She could set it down just about anywhere and it would easily stay where it was left. I don't know how many generations this current purchase is from the original but it's not even close to the same thing. It doesn't feel as solid. The base is smaller. If Mom is setting in her chair and sets this cane on an even floor it easily falls over. This is no where close to the original and certainly isn't something I'd consider helpful for an older person. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn S.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand on its own well, tendency to skid.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought two hurricanes. The first one stood up on its own pretty well and in general I liked it. The second one I bought which I'm using now, does not stand up at all even when leaned against a wall. I need to buy another cane,but not sure I'll buy the hurricane again. It's annoying when you have to use a cane and it falls to the floor making it hard to pick it up on your own. Also I've found this second one I bought has a tendency to skid if you encounter even a small amount of water. I hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Dering

customer_reviews.title: WARNING  TRIPPING HAZARD
customer_reviews.text: I am recovering from knee surgery and bought this to help me walk. I did not realize this was the folding version but did not think that would matter. Well I was walking one day and my foot stepped on the three point "claw" at the bottom of the cane and as I continued with a step the cane started to unfold on me and I tripped. It has since happened twice since, The cane itself is great but with that "claw" at the bottom it is a hazard with the folding option. Get one without the folding option. You could seriously injure yourself.with this model.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID M. DEMARTINIS

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my purple HURRYCANE! Not embarrassing at all and the movement at the bottom is like no other! Smooth walking!
customer_reviews.text: I love my HurryCane! Knowing I needed to have one and they were actually using this at my PT appts which was great this is the one I,ordered in purple! I get a lot of compliments on my HurryCane! It folds up super nice in three sections to put in a bag they provide! The best part is you don't feel awkward walking with it, because it has a moveable bottom like a joint that goes with the flow of your ankle movement. And it does truly stands upright on its own! LOVE IT and the price was much less than I had anticipated!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I love this cane! I was looking for a can to replace my Vive cane. I needed one with more stability and overall better quality. I chose this one based off of reviews. The color looks much better in person. The handle is pretty comfortable. It takes a few weeks of use for the the bottom to swivel better. It starts out a bit stiff but, it adjust over time the more you use it. This cane works well on all surfaces but, I would not trust it to stand up on it's on own on an uneven one.
customer_reviews.author: reese

customer_reviews.title: MY FAULT- not the cane for me at this time
customer_reviews.text: this product is not what I need -I am just progressing from a walker to a cane after hip replacement surgery. this cane is not sturdy enough for someone who Needs stability, and - the base is small and the cane falls if you leave it in place - without holding on to the strap.- the collapse feature is not for someone who has to Rely on the cane while ambulating, since it collapses on its own at times, this cane is PERFECT for someone who needs the occasional balance assistance, or- to ensure a seat on the bus, if the other riders are considerate --
customer_reviews.author: catlady

customer_reviews.title: No
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a cane that would stand up on its own. This one does as long as you are careful to place it but one little tap and it’s down. It feels wet wobbly when fully extended to tall so I have to use it down one notch. Even then, it feels Unsteady. It feels unsteady if you have to put a lot of stress (weight) on it. I’m going to try to return it, but I don’t know if I can get it packaged up and sent back. After all, I got it because walking is hard and painful for me. I should have read the reviews. Not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: C. L. Kehoe

customer_reviews.title: Do not trust it for long term use. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer said, it's held together with a bungie cord, and his broke because it's only anchored by a piece of plastic. What could possibly go wrong with that! My wife needed something right away, so Prime was fast, just one day! I'd recommend one that locks the sections like ski poles. I plan to epoxy the sections with Iron Weld. We don't need to collapse it. As a side note: Their ad hypes all the technological advantages of the 3 contact foot version, but offer a more stable 4 contact foot model for $13 more!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kitsko

customer_reviews.title: It topples over very easily. I wish that I would have looked to ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this based on it's reputation in the marketplace. However, in hindsight, I wish I would have done my homework. The Hurrycane has a trio (3) base) and it VERY flimsy. It topples over very easily. I wish that I would have looked to find one with FOUR pads on the base. I have had multiple people tell me this would have made a huge difference following my TRKR (Total Right Knee Replacement).
customer_reviews.author: Vicki L. Wallace

customer_reviews.title: ... result of bottom section not having a tightening method like the top portion
customer_reviews.text: The handle shifts while walking as a result of bottom section not having a tightening method like the top portion. As a result, the cane does not provide proper alignment, support, and stability. I did contact HurryCane, explained the situation to make sure my can was not a defect. That is the mechanics of the cane. Since, I'm recovering from a stroke and still receiving physical therapy, the can will be returned as avoid aforementioned conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Sindle

customer_reviews.title: Not like the ads
customer_reviews.text: I used a HurryCane at PT and loved it. It's an old model, but looks identical to mine. I tried two. Neither of them pivoted, although the ad still says they are supposed to. (I found that very helpful.) The first one I received would not stand on its own either. I returned it and have one that wobbles but stands up by itself some of the time. If I hold my breath. Also, I try to tighten the part that screws it tight, but as soon as I take a few steps, it is loose again. This seems like a design flaw. My son even tightened it, and it still didn't hold. It doesn't live up to its ads.
customer_reviews.author: JASmith

customer_reviews.title: Secure and easily adjusted cane.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this prior to knee surgery. Things I like: easy to adjust the length, holds the length securely, easy to collapse and fold without presenting a risk, comfortable handle. I took a star off because while it can stand on its own, it's a bit precarious and does sometimes fall over if you're not holding it or have stood it up in a secure location. Works well and safely at its primary task for use as a walking cane.
customer_reviews.author: wamaruna

customer_reviews.title: A very versatile and sturdy cane.
customer_reviews.text: I found this cane to be very versatile. It easily beaks down easily into three sections, but they remain connected by a central elastic cord, so that they cannot be separated or lost. It reassembles very easily. It also has a handy wrist strap which also serves to tie the pieces together when collapsed. It does also stand alone on firm flat surfaces, It also adjusts fairly easily for height. I do not know how long the self-setting base will last. I am very heavy and it supports my weight easily. I recommend it without hesitation
customer_reviews.author: Jack Rosenberg

customer_reviews.title: Versatile cane
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this cane after my husband had back surgery. It helped with his stability in walking, which was the only activity they originally would let him do. We really like that it can stand on its' own and has the ability to be adjusted in height. When he first started walking, he was pretty hunched over, so the cane was at a shorter level. Now that his back is healing and he is standing straighter, it has been nice to be able to adjust up the length of the cane. We find it easy to adjust, and it folds down nicely to a small package to carry or pack.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Lin

customer_reviews.title: Solid cane
customer_reviews.text: Wow great product! Wasn’t sure how this would do on a long distance voyage with terrain and salt water but it survived and still holding up. Solid performance from a collapsible cane, held up to my big frame. Easy and quick to collapse when flying in tiny aircraft. Thanks Hurrycane!
customer_reviews.author: chuck moya

customer_reviews.title: Not the best
customer_reviews.text: We bought this brand of cane because it is supposed to be the best. Ours falls down ALL the time. I hoped that we could depend upon it to not fall down, but it spends most of its life on the floor. I really don’t need my dad bent over trying to pick up his cane. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: JET22t

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have to update my opinion of this cane. After using it about three weeks, the handle broke loose and totally came off. With care I could manage to get the cane to stand up by itself, but the slightly movement caused it to fall over. It certainly is not reliable in that respect. All the advertising this cane has is deceptive. The additional handle cover I bought was nice, but was exremely difficult to put on. I don't think it adds all that much especially when the cane falls apart and can't be repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: My problem with this is it fall's to easy. Have to make sure it has balance before ...
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a strong cane. My problem with this is it fall's to easy. Have to make sure it has balance before letting go. Was wanting to use at work but I need to carry things so I have to let go of cane sometimes and it would be more of a challenge to have to pick up the cane . it has three tips on bottom...maybe four would work better. If you really watch it and aren't distracted by other things it can be good. At home it's easier to lean against something so I won't have to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C

customer_reviews.title: Previously used cane! Gross!
customer_reviews.text: Cane looks solid but it has been previously owned and damaged! Wrist band has green ripped off and the whole thing is sticky like it’s been used. Gross!
customer_reviews.author: Reelady

customer_reviews.title: Not My Favorite
customer_reviews.text: For The Price A Waste If Money ! If Your on flat floor should stand by itself to reach something , other than that I prefere Regular good cane for support outdoors! When had knee replaced I got a hemi walker from Amazon which was cheaper than this cane and much safer if you want more than a cane for support! Outdoors in not flat terrain the hirrycane to me was dangerous ! But on flat solid ground work OK if you want to pay that price for a cane
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Nice cane but a lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I was so disappointed with my Hurrycane, especially after watching numerous TV commercials showing the product in use. The cane is not stable; it frequently falls over, regardless of the surface on which is is placed. Since I needed to use the Hurrycane following hip replacement surgery, hip precautions following this surgery prohibit bending over more than 90 degrees, So, I retired the Hurrycane and am now using a standard cane with a sturdy quad tip, It is much more stable and rarely falls over.
customer_reviews.author: Tallylass31

customer_reviews.title: HurryCane won't stand up, hard to balance it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father who just had a surgery, couldn't wait to give it to him. The can will not balance itself, keeps falling over, and of course, he is unable to bend over and pick it up all the time, I gave it to him while he was in the hospital, and he threw the papers and wrapper it came in away, so I can't return it, I am disappointed that it did not live up to all the commercials and information I read about it, and that he can't use it, and I latterly threw my money away, it is totally useless. It is almost like the bottom is too small to balance the can.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: I am an average size person and require a cane. I received this cane 21 days ago and two of the three rubber pads on the base have already come apart. This cane does not feel stable because it lands on the edge of the bottom pad as you walk instead of the flat bottom. ALSO This cane will not stand on its own as advertised. It constantly falls over and you are constantly struggling to pick it up. BUYER BEWARE.
customer_reviews.author: KT1

customer_reviews.title: Hurrycane a little off balance.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this cane so much. TV makes it look great.....and it does. The blue is a beautiful, rich color. My issue is the stand alone factor. It really doesn't unless you hold it, make sure the balance of the cane is steady then, let go. It falls over as much as my regular cane. It's nicely made and there are many height levels. So, I will keep it for around the house. I wish they would get the little feet to balance better. If the company did....I would buy another one!
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen F Celli

customer_reviews.title: I didn't get a chance to use it. I ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't get a chance to use it. I tried to adjust the length imediatly upon receiving it and the button wouldnt come out so I sent it back. i have Multiple Sclerosis and need a cane that doesnt fold up or fall apart so quickly
customer_reviews.author: Cowboymi

customer_reviews.title: I would NEVER recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.text: I do not recommend this product. Do not waist you money, it broke in less then 5 months. The knob that holds it in the adjustable place broke off. I called he told me that is not a defect in the product I lost the knob so they could not replace it. I give this 0 stars it would not submit with out any stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie

customer_reviews.title: SO dangerous!
customer_reviews.text: This cane is TERRIBLE. I tried using it across a smooth linoleum surface and when my foot hit it ever so slightly, the last segment came loose. Thankfully I didn't have any weight on it or I would have fallen. I cannot believe this product is remotely popular. If I had ANY idea that the segments didn't lock, I would have never purchased it. Furthermore, it doesn't even fit the cheap bag that came with it, once I adjusted it for my height -- the handle end sticks out eight or so inches.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best cane ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mom after a friend recommended it so strongly she loaned us her spare she loans out to people to Try because she loves it so much. She’s had hers for many years. So when mom needed one, We borrowed it and after a day, mom Knew it was the one for her. The tried 4 other kinds and they all Either didn’t work For her being left handed or they were hurting Her hand. This worked left handed, and doesn’t aggravate her hands or carpal tunnel. Highly recommend to all to Atleast try it out! Unless your needs are different, this may be the only Cane you ever try!
customer_reviews.author: mustang456

customer_reviews.title: My mom loves this cane - it’s been a game-changer
customer_reviews.text: If you have an aging parent or are a person who needs the extra support from a cane, this cane is your dream come true. I bought this for my aging mother, who also has arthritis, bad knees and hips. She can now do two walks a day, where she previously had trouble walking from room to room. The cane stands on its own and doesn’t fall down the wall. The only caveat I would add is that she also had her physical therapist spend about 10 minutes making sure she was using it properly and that it was adjusted to the right height for her. Like any good equipment, it is important that it be used properly.
customer_reviews.author: RaderRex

customer_reviews.title: Falls all the time!
customer_reviews.text: This cane works great for walking, however if you leave it, you'd expect it to stand on it's own and it doesn't. This cane falls over every time it's left on it's own. This isn't a big deal if you're able to bend down and grab it, but chances are if you need this cane for stability, you may have some difficulty bending down to pick it up. Very annoying that it wont stand on it's own 99% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: ALincoln

customer_reviews.title: This product is very poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about six months ago. Before we go any further let me tell you that I am 6 foot two and way 230 pounds. I was leaning on this cane and the handle broke off. Luckily I managed to catch myself before I hit the ground. I called their customer service and the silence is deafening. They have not responded not even with the courtesy we got your complaint. I suspect they are merely buying this cheap crap from China and flogging it off in the hope that you will just go away when you are unhappy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Philip A. Stein

customer_reviews.title: NOT AS DESCIBED
customer_reviews.text: I was really looking forward to getting this cane. However, Amazon's version of this cane is very INFERIOR to what you see advertised on TV and other websites. The bottom of the cane does NOT ROTATE as advertised or really even bend with you when you walk. I bought this 1-30-2020 and I would NOT recommend this to anyone who wants a true Hurricane type cane.
customer_reviews.author: Bauffy

customer_reviews.title: prevents falls
customer_reviews.text: I hate using a cane at all, but if I must have one this is the bast. The flexible "foot" helps stady me, and the foot is the perfect size. Doesn't get stuck in the cracks in the sidewalk, and n ot so big I bump in it. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Catlover

customer_reviews.title: Love It
customer_reviews.text: When I first got it I was a bit leery that it was too unstable. Then I realized that a single point cane is just as unsteady and when I start to fall I simply put it forward or sideways on two of its feet and it works even better. I found it very important to have the handle at the correct height and your doctor or physical therapist can show you how (or any number of health web sites).
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Won't piviot like it claim to fame,NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for myself, I sprained my right ankle a few months ago and still have problems with it so my physical therapist gave me a cane to use for stability and help me keep my balance,I sprained my ankle from a fall so I wanted something that I could use but could also store, I read that this cane had a pivoting head and would move with you well remaining flat on the floor,I received the cane and tried to piviot the head and to my surprise it didn't move,so disappointed that it didn't do what it said it would do,the only thing it does do is fold up
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke Within 2 Weeks No Warrenty
customer_reviews.text: Cane would not stand on it’s own after 2 weeks. Customer service claimed I had used it to much and would not replace even though I had it only 2 weeks. She said the rubber feet were probably worn off. They look like new after only 2 weeks use mostly on carpet. They offered to sell me one at discounted price, I declined. I did not want a cane somebody else had returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jon O.

customer_reviews.title: Its sturdy and secure.
customer_reviews.text: My mother had him surgery and before that she used about 5 different canes in the previous 5 years. This is a replacement from the last one only because the 3 little nodes at the bottom have warn out at the edges. This product is durable and for the most part is super durable. It is very easy to adjust and anyone can feel confident and secure using this product. She has multiple ones of this with the pandemic. One for home use and one for outdoor use. This is a great purchase! It being a to stand up on its own is a plus at the diner table or counters when needing to get into your purse or backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Designers Critique

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised on Amazon and as you have seen on TV and more!
customer_reviews.text: You will never have to lean your cane against a dinner table and have it slide and fall or have somebody accidentally knock it over. In terms of walking support, even better. Instead of a traditional cane that stings with vibration everytime you strike the ground, the Hurry Cane absorbs your strike and supports every angle and movement and it springs forward with your next step, giving you positive energy. Whoever came up with this cane is a genius. Outstanding product.
customer_reviews.author: MULAN_2003

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Instructions and carry case are located inside folded attached shipping material and thrown away by many including myself. Only found by pure luck and after clipping the plastic ties and then learning it was needed to secure when folding??? Unbelievable lack of thought process and tainting an other wise decent product.
customer_reviews.author: DrProctor

customer_reviews.title: not as expected, changing my review to one star,
customer_reviews.text: Yes it folds, but you have to either hold it to keep it folded, or add some type strap to go around it to keep it folded, Yes, it will stand alone, as long as there is no breeze at all, I ordered it for walking the dog, assuming it would stand alone while I stooped to pick up his business, but is any breeze at all it will topple over..... update, should be charged with false advertising, haven't used this piece of crap since the first week, cheap junk
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: It broke into
customer_reviews.text: I brought the HurryCane on January 2016. I really liked it until on time in the middle of the night, I had to use the bathroom. In the middle of the hall way my HurryCane broke apart. Thank God I was not hurt. I depend on my appliances since my balance is not good from Parkinsons. Please check your HurryCane occasionally to make certain it is good and tight. My husband through it away. God bless.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Two

customer_reviews.title: Be careful how you stand it. Step on the base to pop it back up if you drop it.
customer_reviews.text: If you've been reading reviews then you're already aware that while it can stand on its own, you have to be careful as you let go. If you let go with it too far off center its going to fall. On that note, because its a Tri-base, stepping on the base is pretty effective in popping it back up to where you can grab it without having to bend over to pick it up! I do wish the handle was more comfortable to grip for longer excursions, I've gotten blisters on my hand from it.
customer_reviews.author: FearTheSwans

customer_reviews.title: All Terrain - it ain't, Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The Hurry Cane may be all terrain but it does not stand up by itself on semi-plush carpeting. I was hoping to replace my traditional cane with this. I was very disappointed when I made several attempts to stand it upright on my semi-plush carpeting only to have it fall over each time. This is a deal breaker for me. I'm very disappointed. Don't buy this cane if you have carpeting that is plusher than office grade carpeting.
customer_reviews.author: southbaygal

customer_reviews.title: Would Love to Give This ZERO stars!
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this zero stars I would. This cane broke within 5 minutes of taking it out of the box!! I tried to adjust the height and the elastic snapped instantly. What a waste. I can't believe they ask for 40 bucks for this thing. Skip this and buy something else!
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: I welcome addition to getting better.
customer_reviews.text: This was a great investment. I had an accident and was using a walker for several weeks, but wanted to progress, so felt a cane would be the next step. I felt very comfortable using this completely stable instrument and most of the time it would stand up by itself when not needed. When in the kitchen where I could walk using the counters, I would just hook the handle at the end of the counter and which was easy to do and easy to find when I needed it again. I didn't give it 5 stars as it didn't always stay standing on it's own. t
customer_reviews.author: Jacey girl

customer_reviews.title: Great cane!!! I like it a lot!!!
customer_reviews.text: After buying and returning a cheaper piece of crap on here,I purchased the hurrycane and couldn't be happier.A much better,sturdier,well built cane than the garbage I tried before this one.Save yourself some hassle and buy this cane and leave the garbage where it is.You can't buy a good cane for less money.I tried.Get this cane.You will be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney L. Haynes Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Not for short people or those who need more stability
customer_reviews.text: I'm disgusted! This is not "all-terrain" and it certainly isn't for someone who is a little shorter like I am. I'm 5'3" - that's not so short. It's still too tall for me. The base isn't all that stabilizing and it definitely doesn't stand on its own. I almost fell a couple of times practicing with it because it doesn't stabilize when I put it down at all and the bottom doesn't pivot as they claim. I use forearm crutches and I know how to use canes so it's not that I need practice. This is going back. Save your money!
customer_reviews.author: BorderCollieMom

customer_reviews.title: This cane will keep you balanced and on your feet
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these before, and someone stole it out of my car. I tried using other canes, but I didn't feel as stable, so I ordered another of these. I've tried various canes and a walker, and I think this is the best solution for those who can bear weight on their feet with a bit of assistance. I also like the red color. You might as well have a bit of style even tho' you need a cane.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Kelly

customer_reviews.title: I am a plus size woman that has really bad arthritis in my knees
customer_reviews.text: I am a plus size woman that has really bad arthritis in my knees. I got this as I am still realtivy young and still want to be on the go. I LOVE this. Not only is it easy to use, but extremely stable and doesn't fall down. I can shop with ease or have it at my desk and have it fall over. Hearing a cane fall over for some reason tends to freak people out, they think you have gone down with the cane and is embarassing. My only wish is that it had pattern choices, I just may have to find someone willing to paint ghost flames on it or something to make it not so plain.
customer_reviews.author: 3labmom

customer_reviews.title: As seen on TV
customer_reviews.text: Usually items shown on TV turn out to be disappointing. The Hurry Cane is an exception. There was no disappointment.Exactly as described. I like the bottom "foot" which helps give stability to the cane and hold it up when you are sitting. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: themommazie

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable cane for help with stability. Not for heavy leaning on.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great can to help with issues of stability and gait. Love the color. It is lightweight too. My only wish is that it reliably stood on its own. It has a wrist strap, so when grocery shopping for example, I put it in the cart or use the wrist strap to carry it when I push the cart. I don’t trust myself to bend over and pick it up should it fall. There are instructions to twist the top to adjust but despite those, it still is not totally stable standing alone. Overall a good cane.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: REasonably goodf product
customer_reviews.text: The cane is a reasonably good one considering the price. This is the second one we purchased for my wife. There is an elastic strap associated with the handle to put around your wrist. The one on this cane had been cut and fell off when it came out of the box. This is why i did not give it a 5 star rating. Some one somewhere was very careless with this shipment. Not worth the effort to return.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Boy

customer_reviews.title: Make you you know how to use it properly.
customer_reviews.text: The cane was perfect. Only thing I have to say, is make sure you know how to adjust it. It needs to be set for your height and switch sides so you don't hurt your back. In other words, any medical device needs to be fitted to the person that will be using it. You can do more harm if you aren't using the device correctly.
customer_reviews.author: T Toms

customer_reviews.title: Handle Broke
customer_reviews.text: I broke my hip 7 weeks ago. 2 weeks ago I transitioned to this cane from a walker. I bought it because it was Amazon's highest rated product. More money that other canes. With just 2 weeks of use, the handle broke. This was 1 day after the return policy ended. I have contacted Amazon and they will be sending me a replacement. They would not do a refund. Replacement is acceptable. I did find it to be somewhat stable and I have never folded it up once I put it together. It does fall over frequently if I do not lean it against something. But, I think most canes would be the same.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUPPORTIVE, PORTABLE, SOLID!!
customer_reviews.text: HATE TO SOUND LIKE THE COMMERCIAL BUT I LOVE MY HURRYCANE! I HAD A KNEE REPLACEMENT AND HAVE BEEN USING IT SINCE FOR ASSISTANCE UNTIL I FINISH RECOVERY. IT IS WONDERFUL! SUPPORTIVE, EASY TO CARRY WITH YOU, FOLDABLE, ADJUSTABLE, ETC. HAVE ANOTHER KNEE REPLACEMENT TO GO SO IT WILL SERVE ME WELL AGAIN!!
customer_reviews.author: GrandmaH

customer_reviews.title: Balance Issue’s
customer_reviews.text: Changed my life for the better!!!✨✨✨I will only buy HurryCane’s In the future...✨✨✨👍🏻
customer_reviews.author: bird

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design
customer_reviews.text: I have used this product for less than 1 year. It has seen occasional use - two to three times per week at most. The handle came out of the tube part of the cane. I pushed it back in but it continues to come out. It is a poor design. I cannot get the handle to stay in the tube securely. This is a dangerous situation. Of course there is no warranty on the produce. I will replace this cane with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jerseytom

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended as a better replacement for basic metal "footed" scans.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a "4 footer" stick. The Hurrycane works far better, and most importantly can be used in either hand and will not get in teh way of your feet. The handle is easy to grip and I haven't needed to buy a grip to place over it. The feet will keep teh can vertical on its own on a hard, flat surface, but not so well on a carpet. I haven't bothered to collapse the can for travel, preferring to keep it extended. Overall I really like this cane for walking, and it is strong enough to support me when my knees get weak and threaten to buckle. Three cheers for a such well designed product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Tolley

customer_reviews.title: Defective, flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The handle keeps coming off because the knobs on the side don't fit securely in the holes in the tube. I'm returning it. Overall it seems kind of flimsy. And it's not nearly as stable as the TV commercials lead you to believe.
customer_reviews.author: Carol A. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Solidly Constructed and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy and handy-to-use cane. When it first arrived I thought that perhaps it wasn't worth the price. Now, however, after several months of use, I am completely pleased with my purchase. It is very well constructed and when it is collapsed into three parts, it snaps back to its full length without fiddling with anything. Three pieces/one solid piece: just like that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Shepherd

customer_reviews.title: Works great, easy to size to your needs
customer_reviews.text: Great cane. Holds my 200+ pounds self. Easy to learn and size to your needs. The one issue I have with it is, the band that is ment to hold the cane together when you collapse it down. well that came off as soon as I opened the package. I don't think it was ever connected. Other then that I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Masotti

customer_reviews.title: Great color!
customer_reviews.text: My mother likes that this cane stands up by itself. Because she is not always having to find a place to “hang it” or “lay it down” she is less likely to lose it. And she loves the purple color (that no one else has) that matches her purple 💜
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Mercoleza

customer_reviews.title: Cane doesn't offer much support.
customer_reviews.text: I disliked cane almost immediately. After using a heavier cane for several years the HurryCane seemed to be too light. I weigh almost 230 lbs. and need more support. I didn't have any confidence that this cane offered that. I would not buy cane again. jb
customer_reviews.author: Jay B.

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend cane
customer_reviews.text: If you use a cane this cane works well. The 3 prong bottom is a great improvement, folds up easily and stands up on its own on even flooring. Just a bit expensive for a cane. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: FRANK KELLY

customer_reviews.title: Don't hurry to buy this came!
customer_reviews.text: The major selling point of this cane is that it is supposed to remain upright and standing in place. It doesn't. It falls over all the time whether on carpeted or hard floor surfaces. The triangular base is too small and the slightest surface irregularities send it over! So sorry I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Can Broke within One Day
customer_reviews.text: Cane broke within one day, had trouble returning it since Pandemic; I'm stuck at home. I was charged again. The only good thing was that I was sent another cane which does work. I was charged for both canes, which was wrong, since the cane is unusable.. So, I'm giving this a 2 star review instead of a 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Susan R. Hemann

customer_reviews.title: Great cane
customer_reviews.text: It's nice because it has a wrist strap to prevent it from falling, but if it does fall, just one toe on the 3-foot bottom will bring the handle up. Very stable because of the 3 footed base, grips nicely, and is easily adjustable for height. If only it came with something to wrap it with when folded it would be ideal.
customer_reviews.author: puddytat

customer_reviews.title: Freedom!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love love love this cane. I am walking faster.....it gives such perfect balance. I could not be happier! It does stand... perfect balance. My mood has even improved! HurryCane Freedom is a great value! My favorite color is purple...... it's like it was made for me. My daughter discovered this cane from her friend who is a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Potter

customer_reviews.title: Keeps Me Upright & Secure
customer_reviews.text: This is my second HurryCane. I had the 1st for a number of years. Lost a "foot" and ordered up a new model. It's even better than the 1st. It's a bit longer. I look forward to years of use. I have arthritis in my ankles and knees as well as periodic vertigo. The cane makes me feel so much more secure as I move around.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 3 months
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I feel like this one is important considering it has to do with your every day living. I bought this cane in June and it was broke by the end of aug. The bottom just fell off. There are no screws holding it in, only rubber and glue. I had one with screws on the bottom and it lasted years. The worse thing of all, I almost fell...I was walking walking and didnt know the bottom fell off and when I went to step, it slid. Very disappointed in this product and it'll be the last time I buy one. So if you use a cane all the time, dont buy this one.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten greer

customer_reviews.title: A Practical, Feature Rich & Comfortable Cane
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product & good value. I have used canes for many years but needed something with more than decorative features after an accident. This product provided very good support--it is light weight, comfortable to use (due to rubberized grip), and flexible (due to swivel base). It can stand on it's own (a plus over traditional cane tips) and is adjustable. The best added feature is that this cane folds so that traveling by car or wheelchair is not awkward or problematic. I have approximately 22 wooden carved canes (many with silver crowns and some with silver casting) but this has been my favorite the last 3 months while recovering.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: CAREFUL UNPACKING
customer_reviews.text: Note to manufacturer: Enclose the elastic hand strap in a plastic tube so as not to cut it. Mine was adjacent to the plastic tie strap holding the cane to the cardboard display and I accidently cut it in to when unpacking. Both are black and the same size and are difficult to tell apart for a 77 year old. Just so U know.
customer_reviews.author: Zeke 60

customer_reviews.title: I love this cane
customer_reviews.text: I am a 300 pound woman with severe arthritis in my knees. I lean on it quite heavily and have never had a problem. I have had this cane for almost 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: vlrogers47

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The base doesn’t pivot nearly as much as it would need to differentiate itself from a regular cane. Pretty much a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Gives you stability when standing up.
customer_reviews.text: Love this care. Needed it for only 2 weeks after having surgery. I like that you could place cane on the ground and not have to worry about how you placed it, it always gave support. I am short and it adjusted to right height for me. I did not need it to walk, but to help me stand when getting up from a seated position.
customer_reviews.author: Diane P.

customer_reviews.title: Stable support
customer_reviews.text: This is my second HurryCane folding cane. It has saved me many a mistep and possible fall. I like that it stands on its own as long as it is on a flat surface (not carpeting) and that it folds up easily when you must sit with little room to spare. My first Hurrycane was lost (probably through owner error), and some lucky person is getting the benefit of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Keane

customer_reviews.title: Best cane yet
customer_reviews.text: My mother needs a cane. The first one I purchased with four feet didn't stand hardly at all. When that one broke, I bought this one. It works so much better! The three prongs allow it to stand - except on carpet. Sturdy and well made. The only issue she has is using the adjustment feature described to reset it. It doesn't appear to work as directed.
customer_reviews.author: T. Pawzun

customer_reviews.title: Everything it claims to be and more!
customer_reviews.text: My husband broke my first one by accident. I’m glad though, the new one I got of the same model is stronger stands on its own every time like it claims, and has great traction, even in the snow. It is by far the best cane I have ever owned and I highly recommend it. I’m even thinking of buy a second one to put in the car so I’m always prepared.
customer_reviews.author: J J Fraver

customer_reviews.title: Good choice
customer_reviews.text: I can fold this up and put it in a backpack or shoulder bag with no problem. It is there when I need it. The only problem is, it does fall over sometimes when you leave it standing on its own. But overall it's good. I bought my Dad one for a recent cruise and he loved it (this is an almost 80 year old that had balked at the idea of having to use a cane). It was there when he really needed it, the rest of the time it could be hidden away 😊
customer_reviews.author: Dana Evans

customer_reviews.title: It's Okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought the cane to help me with my hobby - photography. When I'd stop to take a photo, I had to deal with 'where to put or what do with' my cane? I thought this would be perfect, because I could just stand it next to me. The base is small and it Will stand up by itself, but only on an even surface. The handle is comfortable to grip. In my opinion, the "Pivoting Base" does nothing to enhance the cane. I ordered it in red, so if you're into color you have a few choices.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel2063

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for husband who has bad back and knee that collapses occasionally. He’s very happy with ease of use and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Ann M Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Hurrycane Folding Cane
customer_reviews.text: It is sturdy and gives me more balance getting in and out of i.e. cars, elevators subway trains. The three rubber feet are a good size so you don't trip on them. While on the subway I am able to tuck the bottom portion close to me under my feet so passengers don't trip on it.
customer_reviews.author: ssb

customer_reviews.title: Better than regular canes!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mom for Christmas. It is way more stable than a regular cane which is great! She loves that it stands up by itself (though carpet is sometimes iffy) so she doesn't have to drop it on the floor for a moment. And it collapsible! I was skeptical about that (what good is a cane if it folds into itself?) but surprisingly it's very sturdy, the way it locks into itself is pretty cool. I definitely recommend this to anyone who needs a cane!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful, Practical and You Wont Be Sorry
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this cane for my step dad who is having trouble with his balance and needing the extra support. As most people are, he is very shy about having to use a cane but doesn't seem as hesitant with this one. I am so thankful for this wonderful invention!! He says it is the best cane he has ever used. It is very sturdy, very supportive and stands up by itself if you want to stand it by the table or chair. This cane will fold and tuck away. Truly stands alone in its field. . It comes in different colors and I would recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Huskins

product_meta.title: HurryCane Freedom Edition Folding Cane with T Handle, Original Black
product_meta.description: Color:Original BlackThe #1 selling cane on Amazon just got better! This is the cane that is featured on National television! The Freedom Edition includes a re-designed feet locking system with the WhisperFlex base design, for a smooth and silent pivot. Inspired by the Most Advanced Machine on Earth: The Human Body. We built it from the ground up to feel like an extension of the body. Engineered with 4 critical innovations: 1. Stabilizes like a foot: Just like the human foot, the HurryCane gives you 3 points of contact for superior balance and stability. It naturally simulates your instinctive walking motion to provide you firm footing on any surface. Whether you’re sitting or standing, the SteadiGrip base gives you more traction at any angle. 2. Pivots like an ankle: The ankle is the most complex joint in the body because it has the trickiest job: Support your full weight while giving you the flexibility to walk, run and turn on a dime. It automatically pivots to help you maintain balance on inclines, uneven ground and shifting terrain. We designed the HurryCanes proprietary pivoting head to meet the same demanding standards - and it does it all, automatically. 3. Bends like a knee: Your knees bend to help you get in and out of restrictive places like cars. But the HurryCane is even better: Instead of one joint, you get 2! When you need to store it in a purse, glove box or under a chair, the HurryCane folds up in seconds to one-third its normal size. And when you need, it flips out instantly. While our cane has two joints, it’s still strong and sturdy enough to be pressure-tested to support 350 pounds. 4. Changes in height: People come in all different heights. With just the push of a button, it instantly adjusts to any of 8 convenient heights, ranging from 30.5\ to 37.5". To enhance your mobility experience add these HurryCane Accessories: HurryCane Replacement Feet the Heavenly Handle. Weight capacity of 350 lbs.
feature_bullets: Cutting-edge, patented technology allows the HurryCane, the #1 selling cane in America, to feel like a seamless extension of the body
Innovative SteadiGrip stabilizing technology increases traction and improves balance during both indoor and outdoor use
Customize the fit of the HurryCane by adjusting the handle height setting between 30.5" and 37.5". Base size: 3.5 inch, folded size: 13.7 inch
The HurryCane stands on its own by your side when you need it, and folds up compactly in seconds when you’re sitting. Do not use cane if cord is cut, frayed or damaged
Weight capacity: 350 pounds; The importance of HurryCane is keeping people mobile. The HurryCane's pivoting base gives users a point of contact with the cane at all times

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
